numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Most dots are in a higher percentile.
2. A higher percentile believes that the world is getting better.
3. These dots indicate the younger generation.
4. The younger generation is 15-24 years old.
5. Many people who are 15-24 years old agree that the world is getting better.
6. Few people who are 40 years old or older agree that the world is getting better.
7. I wonder why the younger generation believes that the world is getting better.
8. I think that the world today is more accepting than the world in the past.
9. I think that this is a reason why the younger generation believes that the world is getting better.
10. The younger generation might live an easier life than their parents.
11. The younger generation might live a better life than their parents.
12. The younger generation might challenge authorities more than their parents.
13. I think that these factors are reasons why the younger generation believes that the world is getting better.
14. Older people might think that the world is becoming worse.
15. Older people might not like how the younger generation handles the world today.
16. Older people might be more traditional than younger people.
17. Older people might generally feel that the world is becoming worse.
18. It is understandable to say that the world is getting worse.
19. Today people have more opportunities to make a difference than in the past.
20. In the past, things were cruel.
21. In the past, there were harder situations to avoid.
22. Times have changed.
23. Many things happen today.
24. Many things do not have to happen.
25. People choose that these things happen.
26. I think that the world will never change for this reason.
